meanings.definition: A small part taken from a longer work
meanings.sent1: The book contained interesting excerpts from famous novels.
meanings.sent2: She read the excerpts from the play to the class.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the book of excerpts and refused to move.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a collection of colorful excerpts from different stories.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to memorize the excerpts for the test.

meanings.definition: To select and use only a small part of a longer work
meanings.sent1: The author excerpts the most exciting parts for the movie adaptation.
meanings.sent2: They will excerpt the key points from the research paper for the presentation.
meanings.sent3: She tried to excerpt the recipe from the cookbook without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: His speech excerpted the wisdom of ancient philosophers in a modern context.
meanings.sent5: The artist will excerpt inspiration from nature for the new painting.
